decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (A.005, A.006, C.24 - received 19/06/2017) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - The glass entrance doors and shop windows hereby approved shall be clearly defined with visual manifestations on the glass at two levels: between 850mm to 1000mm and 1400mm to 1600mm above ground level. The manifestations shall be fixed to, painted on or etched into the glass in the form of a continuous or broken (by no more than 20 mm) horizontal band 50 mm high, or a series of signs or logos at least 150mm high spaced no further than 300 mm apart.  The manifestations shall visually contrast with their surroundings when viewed from both inside and outside the building in all lighting conditions.
The door shall either be of an automatic opening type or shall have a 400 millimetre high steel kick plate attached across the full width at the base, and the door edges shall be designed in such a manner that they are clearly identifiable for a person with impaired vision from the adjoining shop windows when closed.
The doorway shall have a threshold that is level with the adjoining footway and the internal floor, or shall be designed to have a gradient between the two not exceeding 1:12 that does not impede the passage of a wheelchair.
description: Installation of a shopfront with assoicated signage
